# Government Tender Announcement

## Title
**Trenching Work for an Automated Radiosonde Launching System**
English: Trenching Work for an Automated Radiosonde Launching System at the Inukjuak Upper Air Station
French: Travaux de creusage de tranchée pour l’installation d’un lanceur automatique de radiosonde à la station aérologique d’Inukjuak

## Reference and Solicitation Information
- **Reference Number**: PW-22-01006415
- **Solicitation Number**: 5000067250T4
- **Posting Date**: September 7, 2022
- **Tender Closing Date**: September 27, 2022 at 14:00:00 (Eastern Standard Time)

## Contract Information
- **Contract Period**: From Contract Award to October 31, 2022
- **Contract Type**: Request for Proposal (RFP)
- **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open bidding

## Scope of Work
The contract requires the successful contractor to perform trenching work at the Inukjuak Upper Air Station in Quebec, Canada to prepare for the installation of an Automated Radiosonde Launching System (LAR) and an Automated Weather Station (AWS). The work will be completed from the Contract Award to October 31, 2022.

## Procurement and Contracting Information
The contract is subject to the Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement (CLCA) of the James Bay and Northern Quebec Agreement, as well as the Northeastern Quebec Agreement. The Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) applies to this contract. Bidders owned or led by Canadians from under-represented groups, such as women, LGBTQ2+ persons, persons with disabilities, and persons from visible minorities, are encouraged to submit a bid.

## Contact Information
- **Contracting Authority**: Andersen, Caitlin at caitlin.andersen@canada.ca or 289-348-0283
- **Contracting Agency**: Environment and Climate Change Canada

## Additional Information
- **Documentation**: Refer to the tender document, available at https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/09/07/c04c4642918184d5bdec8e5e7371434c/5000067250rfpdraften_final_trenching_t4.pdf and https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/09/07
